techmeme.title: The US DOJ indicts 14 North Korean nationals for allegedly making $88M+ via fraud by working as remote IT workers for US companies from April 2017 to March 2023 (Jonathan Greig/The Record)
The BBC complains to Apple after Apple Intelligence's notification summary falsely suggested the BBC had published an article saying Luigi Mangione shot himself (Graham Fraser/BBC)
Sources: Walmart is leading a $300M+ round alongside Ribbit Capital for Walmart-majority-owned fintech venture, One, giving it a $2.5B pre-money valuation (Bloomberg)
Sources: the US is preparing rules restricting the sale of GPUs to some countries in Southeast Asia and the Middle East, to limit China's ability to access them (Wall Street Journal)
In a blog post, OpenAI says "You can't sue your way to AGI", and publishes emails from Elon Musk showing he wanted to own OpenAI and run it as a for-profit (Ina Fried/Axios)
